column2: A public class or interface that does not have a Javadoc comment affects maintainability.
column4: This type does not have a non-trivial Javadoc comment.

column2: A non-constant field that is not declared 'private', but is not accessed outside of its declaring type, may decrease code maintainability.
column4: This non-private field is not accessed outside of its declaring type.

column2: A variable name that begins with an uppercase letter decreases readability.
column4: Variable names should start in lowercase.
